nodes.bodyText: This seems pretty hacky. It seems like we should just be initializing a variable with the current date to control what date the user is looking at, and then never use Date() again.

nodes.bodyText:
todaysDate gets initialized as Date() initially, which is a global property. In case of the month filter, it gets updated to todaysDate.endOfMonth(), so when a user selects back the day filter, I'm resetting it back to the current date and later the stats are filtered using todaysDate.endOfDay as per existing implementation.
This was implemented to block users checking future stats which will be NA.
